languageKey.label: FTP Transfer

Allows to transfer files via FTP on a regular time base. If files get transfered from the local machine to another server you can move the files to another local location after successfull transfer. When transfers succeed/fail it can get configured to have an email message sent.
Container
This task can act as container for other tasks. Each task listed herein will get executed in a chain. One task can pass data to other tasks using a specified interface.
FTP configuration
FTP hostname
FTP port
FTP username
FTP password
Path configuration
Source path
Failed path
Target path
Logging configuration
Perform logging
Log page UID
E-Mail addresses
Success e-mail
Failed e-mail
Fatal e-mail
Sender email
Move to target location instead of copy
Move to failure location instead of copy

Chained task for target location success
(This makes only sense when not moving)

Chained task for failure location success
(This makes only sense when not moving)
Chained task for fatal files
UID of chained tasks as comma separated list

You have to fill in a valid filesystem or FTP path
The path must exist and has to point to a directory

This field is optional.
If filled, the path must exist and has to point to a directory
You have to fill in a valid FTP hostname or IP address
You have to fill in a valid IP port
You have to fill in a valid FTP username
You have to fill in a valid FTP password
You have to fill in the UID of a TYPO3 page where logs should get stored
You have to fill in a valid email address
Invalid input
The input for this field is not valid
Some of the fields regarding the FTP transfer have not been filled correctly
Filename
Filesize
Target filename after successfull transfer
Target filename after failed transfer
Success
Failed
Error messages
Timestamp
Upload of file succeeded
WARNING: Upload of file failed
ERROR: Can't move file to failure location
